comments:
I tryed the tutorial suggested in the 'tutorial web page' from the WTP web site : http://java.sys-con.com/read/180402.htm and I got the following error when I tryed the following action: "Once we have these files imported (an appropriate package called "services" will be automatically created), we'll simply highlight StockService class, right-click, and select Web Services - Create Web Service from the context menu".

After having selected "Web Services - Create Web Service" on the popup menu from the StockService, I got the following error.

The fact is that I did'nt choose Tomcat but JBoss as the web container.

Not related to the JSF project. Moving it to the Webtools project.
I am running RedHat WS 3 update 4.

The stack trace matches, and the exception is occuring on the same line of code, as documented in bug 159458. As Kathy wrote in bug 159458 comment 1, the problem can occur "if the user (e.g.) deletes the runtime, deletes the entire server adapter plugins, or is using a workspace from another product that has a different server adapter".

I'm not sure if any of these situations apply to the history of your workspace, however, a quick test is to start up WTP on a fresh workspace, target Apache Tomcat, and try the scenario again.

Please note that Web services do not work out-of-the-box on JBoss per bug 140994. For reasons we have not investigated yet, server-config.wsdd is not apparently surviving the journey from the workspace to the deployed WAR on the JBoss server.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 159458 ***

(In reply to comment #3)
> I'm not sure if any of these situations apply to the history of your workspace,
> however, a quick test is to start up WTP on a fresh workspace, target Apache
> Tomcat, and try the scenario again.


OK, you found it !
With a fresh workspace, it works
Many thanks
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
